Also agree, a good approach. Just remember that this group (nihontostudy) will not allow attachments. Therefore, it might be good to ask for interested parties to request a copy privately. While I do have a good library myself (knew your dad since ~1970) but sometimes in a case like this, something "missing" turns up, to be added to the shelf. Then one day...my children will be doing what you're thinking of doing. :-)

Ron
STL

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Dean Hartley 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, November 21, 2011 10:10 AM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection


    
  I have the opposite problem. My father, Col Dean S. Hartley, Jr., left a large selection of reference books, most in Japanese. I will be selling these once I have an idea of what they are. I want them to go to people who will use them. I want to get a fair, but not exhorbitant price for them.

  My thought is to take photos of the covers or title pages and make a pdf of the lot. Does this appear to be a useful approach?

  Dean Hartley
  Dr. Dean S. Hartley III

  Dear,
  is there anybody who can help me for cheaper solution than to buy the "new" 3 books? Used or copy?
  Or some download PDF?
  I would be thankfull!
  Best regards from cold Germany,
  Eckhardt
